title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe any of the following conditions that distinguish a natural monopoly from a typical monopoly.

· The firm has decreasing average total cost over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm experiences economies of scale over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm has a marginal cost curve that is constant or decreases over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm’s average total cost decreases everywhere.

The response describes any of the following conditions that distinguish a natural monopoly from a typical monopoly.

· The firm has decreasing average total cost over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm experiences economies of scale over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm has a marginal cost curve that is constant or decreases over the entire range of market demand.

· The firm’s average total cost decreases everywhere.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the remaining criteria.
The response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes four of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes five of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both criteria below.
